channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The coronavirus crisis has prompted investors to reconsider which assets provide portfolios with more ballast in stressful times.
item.title: Preparing portfolios for the next market storm

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 403,000 and there are more than 7 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: US enters recession as global COVID-19 cases surpass 7 million, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: While the policy shift will be welcomed by many struggling centres, it has concerned childcare advocates, unions and economists.
item.title: Warnings that women will be hardest hit by reintroduction of childcare fees

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Sydney's two AFL teams are still waiting for the green light from the NSW government but expect up to 350 supporters will be allowed to attend this weekend's games.
item.title: Loyalty and luck: How Swans, Giants could pick which fans go to games

item.description: It is a disturbing number that has risen for decades in the backs of police cars, behind the walls of Australia's prisons and in plain sight.
item.title: Indigenous activists urge more Black Lives Matter support

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Despite global markets spiking on reports of COVID-19 treatments, analysts say ASX-listed companies are unlikely to get a boost from any major breakthroughs.
item.title: Vaccine breakthrough no profit blockbuster for local biotechs: analysts

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A Sydney investor, with an overseas partner, has outlaid $21.3 million for a Woolworths-anchored shopping centre in Coburg on a passing yield of 6 per cent.
item.title: Suburban Melbourne Woolies centre sells for $21m

item.description: The Black Caucus handed out the cloths to the elected representatives. The sartorial statement quickly went viral, sparking strong reactions on social media.
item.title: Kente cloth is beloved in Ghana. Why did Democrats wear it to launch push against police brutality?

item.description: Michael Gleeson, Caroline Wilson and Jake Niall discuss which team might be most affected â€“ and whether it will have an impact on who wins the flag.
item.title: Real Footy podcast: Which club will be most affected by the new season structure?

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: The body of a Gabriella Delaney was discovered by police after interstate family members called police with concerns for her welfare.
item.title: Brother arrested over the death of his sister in Sydney's west

item.description: A father who likely killed his five-month-old baby with a blow to the head should not be released from jail, Queensland prosecutors say.
item.title: Accused Queensland baby killer applies for bail

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: The VRC's reluctance to move the Melbourne Cup carnival from the first week in November ultimately worked against the MRC's desire to avoid a clash with AFL finals.
item.title: The race that stops a calendar reshuffle

item.description: Amid a slew of headlines over his relationship with disgraced financier and convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, efforts are being made to rehabilitate Andrew's reputation.
item.title: Prince Andrew's meticulously planned fightback begins

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The coronavirus has taken its toll on mall owner GPT, which has been forced to write down the value of seven of its key centres by almost $500 million.
item.title: Shop til you drop: Mall giant GPT takes $500m COVID hit

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The man was pulled to the ground by nearby residents until police arrived.
item.title: Qld man charged after police chase in allegedly stolen vehicle

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: A convicted rapist bashed his Melbourne housemate to death in the grip of bizarre conspiracy theories, including tales of poison and human trafficking.
item.title: 'Demonic': Woman faces man who killed husband in brutal backyard bashing

item.description: I had occasionally thought of pulling the plug before, but being trapped in the same home has left me no option.
item.title: Lockdown put the nail in the coffin of my eight-year marriage

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Matthew Wade has never been short of a word on the field but the Australian batsman may opt to keep quiet against an Indian side that thrives on "energy".
item.title: Zip it: Australians may change verbal tune against India

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: There were plenty of questions and dollops of hand sanitiser as 618,000 students from years 3 to 10 returned to school for the first time in months on Tuesday.
item.title: Temperature checks, sanitiser and questions galore on first day back in class

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The national broadcaster will progress its plans to axe 200 jobs, with plans to unveil its five-year strategy before the end of the month.
item.title: ABC pushes ahead with job cuts in 'arduous year'

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australia's childcare centre workers are mainly women and they're about to find out what it's like to be part of a government JobKeeper experiment.
item.title: Women running childcare centres about to face more upheaval

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: But the LNP administration says it is entirely the role of the federal government to determine unemployment payment rates.
item.title: Brisbane City Council urged to lobby for JobSeeker reprieve

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The tourism industry is giving up hope of a pre-Christmas revival, asking the government to extend JobKeeper until international borders reopen and expand the scheme to include visa and seasonal workers.
item.title: Tourism industry calls for JobKeeper extension until international borders reopen

item.description: A father accused of killing his five-month-old baby with a blow to the head should not be released from jail, Queensland prosecutors say.
item.title: Accused Queensland baby killer applies for bail

item.description: Australian Mitch Docker anticipates cyclists to hit mental and physical walls if the revamped 2020 season proceeds as planned.
item.title: Docker raises concern about delayed cycling season

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Prosecutor Carmel Barbagallo is expected to begin her closing address to Justice Stephen Hall this afternoon following a month-long adjournment.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: State to begin its closing argument

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: In this episode, senior journalist Jacqueline Maley and chief political correspondent David Crowe discuss the controversial Queen's birthday honours awarded over the weekend.Â
item.title: Please Explain podcast: the politics of the Queen's birthday honours

item.description: The first American woman to walk in space is now the first woman to reach the deepest known spot in the ocean. When she resurfaced, she rang the space station.
item.title: Retired astronaut, 68, becomes first woman to dive to bottom of the ocean

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: News Corp is axing production roles across its newsrooms and has flagged job cuts at The Australian.
item.title: More jobs to go at News Corp in metro restructure

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: A man jailed over the murder of his pregnant secret lover in Western Australia more than a decade ago will walk free after being granted bail prior to his retrial.
item.title: After 12 years in jail for a crime he says he didn't do, Scott Austic is about to walk out

item.description: Six-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has called on governments to remove statues of "racists" who made money selling slaves after a British monument was torn down on Sunday.
item.title: Hamilton challenges British government to step up

item.dc:creator: Benjamen Judd
item.description: Forget that new coat and invest in a comfy new throw for your couch instead.
item.title: Winter wrap: A blanket is the only accessory you need right now

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Chris Scott is keen to play Jack Steven but is weighing up whether it is prudent to do so on Friday night against the Hawks.
item.title: Cats still weighing up Steven selection, says Scott

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Fed-up Wests Tigers coach has made the controversial decision to drop in-form club legend Benji Marshall following the club's weekend loss to the Gold Coast.
item.title: Wests Tigers bombshell: Maguire drops Marshall after Titans shocker

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Withdrawn after COVID-19 hit, the property was then relaunched 10 days ago as a private sale before being quickly sold.
item.title: Red Scooter's warehouse conversion sells for $2.16m

item.dc:creator: Ben Grubb
item.description: The Australian beverages giant behind milk brands Dairy Farmers and Pura and XXXX Gold beer has been hit by a major cyber attack
item.title: Drinks giant Lion hit by cyber attack as hackers target corporate Australia

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Fans will be back in the stands when the AFL resumes in Adelaide this weekend, but the AFL wasn't aware of SA government's decision until it was made public.
item.title: Footy crowds to return in Adelaide this weekend

item.dc:creator: Steve Dow
item.description: This year the Victorian Seniors Festival has gone online, with performances and interviews shot in performers' lounge rooms.
item.title: Older, wiser and more fabulous: seniors sing to their smartphones

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: 51 Worldwide Classics is a glossy and generous collection of tabletop standards and rainy day time wasters, perfect for a night in with the family.
item.title: Nintendo's fresh take on some very old game night favourites

item.description: The Benambra Buck Runners have been capturing wild brumbies for decades. They are angry about the Victorian government's proposal to cull the high country icon by shooting and want a chance to work with government to manage the population.
item.title: The Benambra Buck Runners

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The seven-member jury has publicly released its feedback on proposed visions for the controversial riverside museum.
item.title: Jury feedback revealed for rival Powerhouse designs

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The Kings captain has called time on his basketball career due to a chronic ankle injury.
item.title: 'A genuine blow': Sydney Kings lose another star as Lisch retires

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: A five-star Margaret River hotel expected to open in 2023 has been hailed as evidence of long-term confidence in the state's tourism sector despite pandemic travel restrictions which have devastated the industry.
item.title: Margaret River's long awaited five-star hotel to kick start tourism industry

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police declared a crime scene at a suburban Cairns home after finding the body of a 76-year-old woman about 6.30am. The man, known to the woman, is assisting police.
item.title: Man restrained in north Queensland home before discovery of body

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: The opposition to testing from some officials of the government's health department came after six people died and more than 800 were infected aboard the Diamond Princess in Japan in February
item.title: 'Overkill': Senior NSW Health officials opposed COVID testing on cruise ships

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Sydney are suddenly short on key-position players before the AFL's season restart with first-choice ruckman Sam Naismith reporting tightness in his hamstring.
item.title: Swans' injury problems mount with Naismith in doubt for Bombers clash

item.description: West Coast ruckman Nic Naitanui - arguably one of the biggest stars in WA footy - has a break from constant autograph requests in Queensland as he flies under the radar on the Gold Coast.
item.title: Nic who? Eagles superstar enjoys Gold Coast life

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Man arrested over killing of Vincent Chi, owner of the China Bar restaurant at Northland Shopping Centre, has appeared in court charged with theft and murder.
item.title: Man fronts court charged with murder of China Bar restaurant owner

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: The NSW Court of Appeal said police displayed "commendable co-operation" in filling out a form to authorise the protest on Saturday.
item.title: Police gave green light to Sydney Black Lives Matter march in email: court
